title: Define ToolSource protocol and source registry

task.title: Define ToolSource protocol and source registry
task.description:
## Context
Create the abstraction layer for tool sources, following the same pattern as TaskBackend. This enables pluggable source adapters and a registry for discovering available sources.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Follow `cub/core/tasks/backend.py` patterns for Protocol and registry.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/__init__.py`
2. Create `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/base.py`
3. Define `ToolSource` Protocol with `name`, `fetch_tools()`, `search_live()`
4. Implement source registry with `register_source()` decorator
5. Implement `get_source(name)` and `list_sources()` functions
6. Implement `get_all_sources()` to return all registered sources

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `ToolSource` Protocol is runtime_checkable
- [ ] `ToolSource.name` property returns source identifier
- [ ] `ToolSource.fetch_tools()` returns `list[Tool]`
- [ ] `ToolSource.search_live(query)` returns `list[Tool]`
- [ ] `@register_source(name)` decorator registers a source class
- [ ] `get_source(name)` returns source instance or raises ValueError
- [ ] `list_sources()` returns list of registered source names
- [ ] `get_all_sources()` returns list of all source instances
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/__init__.py` (new)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/base.py` (new)

## Notes
- Use `typing.Protocol` with `@runtime_checkable` decorator
- Registry pattern: module-level dict `_sources: dict[str, type[ToolSource]]`
- Sources are instantiated on demand, not at import time
